content.label:
Normally I HATE these types of games. Maybe because it‚Äôs warhammer I actually have the patience for one of them this time, my only real complaint is that I completed one of the warpstone challenges by filling in my email as the conditions said, but I haven‚Äôt received any warpstone. I‚Äôm worried that if I do the warpstone challenges that gives me five thousand for donating to a wildlife preservation effort it‚Äôll jip me again.

Also: Alliance coins are great, and they open a lot of avenues. But shields, invigorating drafts, and warlord xp should NOT be more than 20,000. That‚Äôs kind of outrageous, the same goes for warlord honours. None of them really affect the tier level of your troops so it doesn‚Äôt really do much for your advancement, shields should just be more easily accessible anyway, and a warlord honour shouldn‚Äôt be 2,500 for ONE of them. This game is great but it could use a bit of improvement, 

What really has me shocked is long list of entertaining mechanics this game has that I‚Äôm not going to write down because I took too long writing this review already. The only way I could see this game being more fun is if we got cutsecenes for our warlords taking on foes or our troops taking on enemy armies. Including enemy player armies. Keep up the good work!

title.label: Do not use the click bait sponsored ads

content.label:
I haven‚Äôt really been playing games on my phone at all, but I like the warhammer universe and thought I‚Äôd give it a shot. The game is actually pretty enjoyable. I wish there was a little more action, like actual battles you could view, or at least the champion fights. But it‚Äôs really just a numerical strategy game with a nice skin. Still fun though. 

My biggest issue with the game is the sponsored ads you use to get in game currency. I clicked on one that had an astronomically high amount, it was a link to an online wine shop. You had to sign up and make a purchase, so I did. I figured, if I was going to spend money to get digital currency, I might as well get some wine.  I signed up, for the confirmation email, made a purchase, got the email, waited.... waited.... I could make a claim ticket for 24 hours, so I waited some more. Submitted my claim ticket with a screenshot of my purchase email. 

They responded and said I didn‚Äôt do what I was supposed to do to complete the ad and asked for proof that I had. I already sent them the screenshot of my purchase, so I sent another screen shot of my welcome to Winc email to show I had subscribed. Now I‚Äôm sitting here waiting for a response. 

Just don‚Äôt use any of their click bait and you should be fine. The games good enough, but I‚Äôm not happy that they got me to sign up for a $40 a month wine club and didn‚Äôt give me my credit... which is just a valueless in game currency that they could have easily just said, ‚Äúoh, looks like something went wrong. Oh well, here you go (click)‚Äù and made a happy consumer. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

So, first and foremost this game is absolutely pay to win. Grindy by design and growth is only tolerable when the multiple build mechanics are in full swing. Excessive resources means more things designed to open your wallet. 

Beyond that however, it‚Äôs combat systems are interesting. PvP is a solid spot for the game. Quick and speedy when up close and personal. Only mmo that I‚Äôve ever been into prior was tribal wars so the pvp element is a huge plus. 

Next bit however is bizarre and why I‚Äôm actually writing this review. It crashes constantly. As of today this game will shut itself off in like 3-5 minutes. Which is garbage.

title.label: Cool, but same old same old.

content.label:
I like the game so far. But it‚Äôs the same old game like a lot of empire strat games we have already seen. This just so happens to be Warhammer. Which is why I really want to give this game a try. 

Seems to be a good community. Very friendly and helpful. Major time sink and there is a pay 2 win system but it‚Äôs not too bad. So give it a try is you like all things Warhammer
Games gotten better and a lot more fleshed out. You must pay to be competitive is the bottom line with this one. This is a game where top competitors are thousands deep.

I‚Äôve really enjoyed the Warhammer Fantasy lore for a while now, so I started looking for games that I could play that involved it! I stumbled across this game and, long story short, this is now my favorite!
Must have thousands of dollars to play otherwise your not even a speed bump.

title.label: Pay to win or go home

content.label: This game is really fun, building, learning, and making new friends in alliances.  That is, until a grown man who admittedly pays several hundreds of dollars a month to dominate an entire server wipes you out, ruins your game, and then laughs at you in private message.  This game is completely pay to win.  And the developers want it that way.  As long as they make money, who cares if you have fun.
This game is an expensive chat room with a war game function. Find me on Throgg4.
A lot of pvp games bring out the worst in people.  If you want to play with the biggest aholes in the app store this is the game for you.

Amazing game and community. I played it every day for over a year; however, with the new server merge the integrity of the game was ruined. Many of my friends have already quit, and I expect to soon as well.
Perfect game for players who don‚Äôt like to feel rushed. Fun and smooth however, higher level promotions are extremely long and tedious. Regardless, I find myself coming back for more

Tech support will tell you that when you get attacked and receive no notifications on this that it was a ‚Äúthird party‚Äù issue. Do not waste your time or money on this game. Ive spent 220+ days (login streak) to get told the game has a known issue but its not their fault!
Really loving this game
This game is wonderful, I finally get to be a chaos lord! Long Live Nurgle!

title.label: All the bullying and class mistreatment you can buy

content.label:
The really sad thing about this game is it could have been really great. The idea behind it was solid, there are some amazing people who play, and some of the events and challenges are great taking more than just a point and destroy mode of game play unlike a lot of games in this genre.
    Now to the crux of the one star rating. The game is set up in such a way that if you play, to really succeed you have to hope to get brought into whichever realm you wind up ins most powerful alliance if not be prepared to stay low level for awhile. Of course as is the design of these games you can spend real world money, but even that is no guarantee of success. This game is geared to cater to the largest alliance. You spend months and months building up to get caught up in an angry temper tantrum by someone in the two or three strongest alliances and you can no longer even go to get the resources you need to get larger or stronger and to even heal the soldiers you lost trying to get your resources so you can‚Äôt even heal them to continue trying to grow.
   Hope that you don‚Äôt get caught with a lower shield because even though you have ‚Äúdefenses‚Äù a player one level above you in the strongest alliance will cut straight through your defenses that you have spent months building up, and kill all your troops. Now you have no troops to send out, if they didn‚Äôt get attacked on the gathering trip, no resources to heal with and you permanently lose some in the process. All while you are just trying to play the games normal challenges of fighting the monster armies or empire armies. Your alliance members can‚Äôt help because they are having to heal and save themselves. The idea of creating a system that allows one or two alliances to dictate how every other player can or can‚Äôt play is beyond ridiculous.
   The developers are constantly commenting oh how can we improve or fix these problems, but no real action is being taken. Many people have offered some great ideas, such as adjusting how much offense you can use to attack another weaker player. Adjusting the attack versus defense dynamic. Make the game more focused on the challenges outside of the internal player battles. Using the other regions as a leveling system, if this was put into play a lot of these players who have their regions under their thumbs would have to prove how good they really are when everyone is at the same level. 
   In conclusion this game began as a calming, fun, and believe it or not a brain stimulating game. However it turned into a disastrous experience that I threw way too much money into because I kept thinking if I get stronger the game will be more fair. The truth is it never would have. I wish I had that money back to put into my actual Warhammer models, as at least if I lose a match with them I don‚Äôt literally watch hundreds of dollars and months of time be cast away in the blink of an eye. I know I have rambled on for far to long but this game received a lot of my heart and time and a part of me hopes to either see an actual change take place and the game be fixed, or to save someone else from the waste of time and money that will come from playing this game. If you don‚Äôt believe me open the game up and look around at all the dead fortresses and ask why are so many people that download this game leaving en mass. Hope this review helps someone, cheers!

When it comes to this MMORTS type game, Choas and a Conquest has the best visuals to date. The one gripe I have with it is that it‚Äôs now 2020, and we‚Äôre still stuck with black bars on the top and bottom of the screen (iPhone XS Max). Most games similar to this (even the really crappy ones) have already fully optimized their game to take advantage of the screens real estate. Please update, will def change my score.
Really fun ! Strategy time based game . If you love the warhammer franchise . You‚Äôll appreciate this game . Also JOIN Khorne‚Äôs Kin alliance when you start it lol .
Great game, but I wish the developers would find a way to attract more players and do something about all the dead bases

This used be a 5 star game, but the lack of pvp kill events has all but made this FarmVille 2.0. We finally had an alliance pvp kill event about to start, after waiting weeks for one, when it was cancelled. Only reason to train troops now is to farm. Hope the devs realize that these servers are all dying because lack of wars. ITS A WARGAME....NOT A FARMING GAME.

I hate that walls offer no defense, your army leaves a trail for other people to follow and smash your place up, and these castles and keeps teleport around like their spaceships offering no strategy to low levels or anyone else for that matter.

I had this game before on the exact same device I am using it on now, I played and was dedicated to the game for awhile and while it would crash every so often back then or get extremely laggy it was still fun. But now since I‚Äôve redownloaded the game I can‚Äôt get past the tutorial because of it crashing so frequently. And this is with the graphics dumbed down to its bare minimum. So please, fix the issue with crashing, I want to get back into this game again.
Excellent game

I play the this game for about a month, its a nice game, but  this game will never let you win any event in first place even if you buy most of the packages, they want you to purchase and purchase their sales, even if you got the first place they still have the way to put you down in second place, this game is really a scam, and everytime you report they won‚Äôt respond, THEY WILL JUST SCAM YOUR MONEY,  believe me,

It‚Äôs a good game in all honesty. Does require you to constantly keep up with your notifications but it‚Äôs pretty fun. The bigger servers get a bit toxic but that‚Äôs just how it goes with these games. 

Could use updating though. If you‚Äôre on call and decide to play, the app will crash within the first 30 seconds. Needs some work there. üëçüèª

All in all though, I highly recommend this game!

This game is great!  Embodies Warhammer very well, there is a pay to win aspect but if you want to build up and just enjoy the time chatting with like minded people jump in and find you a good alliance. Don‚Äôt let the bullies bother you, lay low and have fun.

The game is an overall great game. It‚Äôs your typical build, wait, and battle game with a couple quirks that are great. Room to roam on the map, the ability to pick and choose your enemy/NPC enemy, and the resource harvest system. Beware though, balance is not quite worked out yet. It is all too easy for a much stronger enemy to come through and wipe you out. With all the great stuff in there it is fun, when you get to a high enough level you get bullied by the stronger clans though.

title.label: Don‚Äôt get now unless you like getting electronically raped.

content.label: Unless you‚Äôre an early adopter or a masochist, don‚Äôt bother getting as the senior players will attack you with you not having any capacity to retaliate as their defenses can cherish you while yours tend to fall to them like leaves.  If your in the middle of an update you can be attacked, and the game makers start events to make players attack one and other, with lower level players basically victim fodder for the upper level players.  There is no strategy beyond being high level, and at this point, that won‚Äôt be you.
This game is cool, but it will glitch out on you and support will not try to help you.

its a nice game i really enjoyed it but all of the sudden right when i click on the game it loads then it takes me back to the home screen so i cant even play the game anymore yall should try to fix the bug if you can.

title.label: Pay to play makes jack a dull boy

content.label:
Seriously, what is with these games and the pay to play BS. I love the game, it gets 5 stars for being fun... until you have to open your wallet. Sure, you CAN play for free, but you‚Äôll always get dumped on by anyone who puts money into the game and has a basic understanding of how combat works.

I get it, money makes the world go ‚Äòround, but with successful games like fortnite which has no pay to win features, only aesthetics, they STILL take in a significant amount of cash. Why ruin your player base and leave the game to be ruled by the insignificant amount of whales out there when you already have a huge amount of fans for this franchise that you can milk for years to come? You really f‚Äôd the pooch on this game and your marketing.

The games mechanics are fun to work out and the game has a decent amount of things going on to keep players busy. It is reminiscent of the total war games and /can/ be quite entertaining. The major downfall is the fact that I constantly feel like it‚Äôs a game between me and my wallet, and it ruins the fun. I don‚Äôt eagerly await new upgrades that I can just pay for, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fun facing the anxiety of losing troops that I‚Äôve paid real money for, I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs fun to feel like I need to spend money to switch between fighting, building troops, or gathering resources. I don‚Äôt think it is fun to feel like I need to spend money to engage in combat (buying tps so I can hit someone before they throw up a shield to stop an attack). I don‚Äôt think it is fun to wait 2 months to unlock a unit that other people who just happen to have a larger amount of expendable income have unlocked weeks ago. I don‚Äôt think it is fun feeling like I have no chance to compete for the super cool cities and buffs because the majority of the power on the server is held by 3-5 people all in the same alliance. 

Seriously, this game had potential to be a long time earner for this company, it already has an established fan base, the game systems are interesting, specifically the mix of pve and pvp aspects... but you end up having large numbers of players who start playing, then quit because they get screwed over by people who drop money in the game. Then, without those players, you‚Äôre left with a large amount of people who are either very committed to the franchise and are just there to be farmed, or people who have spent a s‚Äî load of money, and no consistent middle ground for your casual players.

I am not going to lie. I spent way more money on this game than I should have. I don‚Äôt feel like it has the longevity of other games, and I also felt compelled to keep up with the Jones‚Äô. I probably will keep playing simply because of the sunk cost, and just that makes me sick to my stomach. 

I am also anticipating a large number of hackers breaking the game following the release on steam, mostly because I know that people would rather hack something like this than pay money into it. The fact that it is pay to win will also make it harder to identify who is hacking because people will just assume the player dropped money, and probably won‚Äôt report. Or vice versa and all spenders are going to start getting reported, wasting the companies manpower and making it harder to deal with the issues. Not only that, but the support for this game seems already lacking. Though, dev input and continual updates are very welcomed.

I‚Äôm really disappointed at the lack of ingenuity and moral integrity of these companies lately that feel like a pay to win structure is what the gamers want and/or feel like it is the only way to make bucket loads of cash. There is more than one way to skin a cat, and this method just shows a lack of imagination. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs fixable, but once you put in one of these structures, you‚Äôre stuck with it because people have already committed cash. I predict this game dying within a year with maybe a few whales staying around which won‚Äôt pay your San Francisco rent for very long.

People are taking this game way too seriously. I‚Äôve reported people for harassment (threatening to not stop unless someone says they do something sexual or threatening to keep attacking until they make an people quit), but the devs said they can‚Äôt punish people for ‚Äúmaking war‚Äù on others. Seriously? Go play something else. You won‚Äôt get anywhere in this game unless you make in game purchases at least once a week, if not more.

Overall a fun base builder with some depth. I really want there to be more ability to specialize in a certain god but there isn‚Äôt a lot of unit variety. The warlord packs also seem to be not useful because they only ever give out souls.
Great castle building game with alot of free contents to keep you busy

title.label: Avoid; Strong Pass; Don‚Äôt Bother; etc

content.label:
First the good:

-Great art direction

-It‚Äôs Warhammer

-The community is generally pleasant

Now the bad:

It‚Äôs 2019 and I think everybody knows that combat and advancement in these types of games, in general, strongly favor players who started very early after release and players who are willing to spend money.  But C&C is one of the most egregious examples I have ever seen.  I‚Äôve spent a decent chunk of cash (between $25.00 and $50.00) and I still get bodied left and right. So let‚Äôs break that down:

For starters, the unit tier structure is totally broken.  Second tier units dominate first tier units and third tier units dominate second tier units.  And by dominate, I mean you can attack tens of thousands of tier 1 units with hundreds of tier 3 units and wipe out the defender without taking loses.  Getting access to higher tier units takes months and months. (unless you‚Äôre willing to pay, of course! üòÉ)  

Those months are drawn out even further because you‚Äôre constantly being robbed by the people at the top of the pyramid and you can‚Äôt accuse enough resources to ascend the tech tree. At this point, I would say it is functionally impossible for a new player to advance high enough up the tech tree to be anything other than a target without spending significant amounts of money.

On top of that, the combat system is a mess.  Attackers ‚Äúswing‚Äù first, units die in tier order (meaning the weakest troops die first,) and ranged attackers have highest attack priority.  The upshot is that players with access to higher tier units can attack anybody lower than them with what amounts to impunity.  The devs have been saying they‚Äôre going to reevaluate the system for months, but come on.  Overhauling a combat system means pulling out the guts of a game and rebuilding it.  The system as it stands favors the people who pay their bills.  Why would they change it?  So, maybe they‚Äôll get to it some day, but I wouldn‚Äôt hold my breath.

Finally, the city capture and Everchosen mechanics give combat and resource buffs to the most powerful players and clans.  The Everchosen mechanic even allows the top player to give DEBUFFS to 8 (?) players of their choosing.

All of this amounts to a game where the powerful are strongly incentivized to prey on the weak.  If the developer‚Äôs intent was to capture what it must be like to live in the Warhammer world, then mission accomplished. If their intent was to create a fun, balanced game than total failure. If the intent was to milk whales, then huge success.

TL;DR:

+Great art

+Warhammer IP

-Strong pay to win mechanics, even by the standards of the genre

Summary: don‚Äôt bother with C&C unless you‚Äôre willing to shell out hundreds of dollars.
The prices for packages are too expensive, I feel more people would buy them if they were cheaper, lower prices, more people buy them, bigger profits.

nothing more exciting than being utterly wrecked by players who spend huge sums of money on the game. being bullied by clans that refuse to finish rss nodes, start high school drama and believe they own the server. the wait time for upgrades is completely ridiculous, 31 days for a upgrade? if you like being subjected to big money players on power trips or waiting long periods of time to upgrade anything then this is the perfect game for you
Great game

Before you even invest a second let alone dollar into this game, let me tell you. You‚Äôve never seen pay to play like this. The more you spend in his game the more devs favor you! title.label: Fun game, but definitely pay to win

content.label:
Love the Warhammer units, lore, and art. It‚Äôs a good game and fun to play with others. 

It‚Äôs a pay to win model though. Unless you pay some you really can‚Äôt compete with those that do pay.

The only thing is that the server I‚Äôm on has mostly quit and so most of the active people are in one of the two or three mega alliances and it honestly takes away from some of the enjoyment. Other than that though it‚Äôs been a lot of fun to play and grow as a Chaos Lord

title.label: Fun but too easy to lose all your work.

content.label: This a fun little kingdom building game and if you have friends it is even better. It is fun right up till a high powered guy comes along and wipes you out. They have too many events that promote pvp and no real way to deal with powerful people who paid to get the best stuff. This game feels like it could be better but for me falls into a just ok category.

Game is great. Don‚Äôt need to be a big spender to be competitive. But, what the game needs is realm wars. It gets boring fighting the same players and alliances on a daily basis. Need to break up the monotony of the same weekly events. Also, the city siege event is a worthless event. Only certain big players sit outside pre-determined cities and capture and release city to gain points.
Love this game and combat system needs improvement
AWESOMENESS!!

No matter how far you choose to go in this game - if you‚Äôre in for as far as the free play allows, or are willing to spend as much as you want for all the extras - you‚Äôre in for a treat. I‚Äôve played several of these type of games and this is by far the most beautifully rendered among them.
